title: 'Impeach Trump' banner hangs at Nationals Park during World Series Game 5
text:
President Donald Trump’s trip to the World Series wasn’t met with the same enthusiasm as one of his political rallies. Quite the opposite, actually.

When he was shown on the video board in the fourth inning and introduced over the stadium speakers, Trump was booed by fans at World Series Game 5 between the Washington Nationals and Houston Astros. Not long after that, fans chanted “Lock him up!”

The political jabs took a backseat to baseball for the next few innings but came back in the seventh inning when fans hung an “Impeach Trump” banner in right field. It was quickly confiscated by stadium security but was up long enough for plenty of pictures to be captured.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

President Trump was a special guest at World Series Game 5, joined by Senator David Perdue of Georgia (right). (Photo by TASOS KATOPODIS/AFP via Getty Images)

Impeach Trump banner up in RF now too. pic.twitter.com/DM9tNxO568 — Henry Coppola (@hcoppola) October 28, 2019

Someone snuck an "Impeach Trump" sign into tonight's World Series game. Was displayed for a few pitches during the top of the 7th. Security quickly removed it. pic.twitter.com/FLZ3mcsUQF — Paul Lukas (@UniWatch) October 28, 2019

TV viewers might have also seen a “Veterans for Impeachment” sign behind home plate.

Story continues

“Veterans for Impeachment” sign behind home plate tonight pic.twitter.com/trBa9Irx3H — Andrew Beaujon (@abeaujon) October 28, 2019

It’s not the first time this has happened. An “Impeach Trump” banner was also hung at Nationals Park on opening day 2017, not long after Trump took office.

———

Mike Oz is a writer for Yahoo Sports. Have a tip? Email him at mikeozstew@yahoo.com or follow him on Twitter! Follow @mikeoz

More from Yahoo Sports:
description: The banner was up in right field in the seventh but was quickly confiscated.
